Key Arguments: The legislation poses a threat to freedom of speech by giving ACMA the power to determine what constitutes misinformation and disinformation.
Historical examples, such as the suppression of Martin Luther's writings, show the dangers of allowing authorities to control information.
Digital platforms should not be forced to comply with ACMA's views under threat of massive fines, as this would make ACMA the arbiter of truth.
Open and free debate is the best way to combat misinformation, not censorship.
Examples from COVID-19, election vote counting, and treatment of gender dysphoria illustrate how suppression of information can lead to mistrust and hinder the discovery of truth.
Notable Quotes: The best way to combat misinformation is to allow open and free debate, not censorship of ideas that someone subjectively considers likely to cause or contribute to serious harm.
Giving ACMA (or any other body) this power will only serve to erode confidence in government and in public servants.
The best remedy to misinformation is free and open debate.
